column4: Hi i have two network cards, onboard (doesnt work) and pci... I changed kernels and the onboard one appeared, but didnt work, and now the PCI one wont work. even when i change back to the other kernel.
what's an alternative to gnome-terminal that is good? (transparency and stuff) I cant use gnome-terminal because i found a bug in it.
yeah
well, it seems the problem also exists with xterm as well
i guess i will have to live without a terminal.
Oh, wait, xterm works. my bad.
I overflowed the integer value for the location of the window or something
basically i have a triple-xinerama setup here. gnome-terminal freaks out if i open it from another term.
Heh, yeah.
i bet it has something to do with overal
just curious, what bug have you found in it?
actually it's not really a *bug*, but it is a limitation.
oh, l33t
maybe
:/ yeah thats terrible, sounds like a very cool setup
i will probably whinge to gnome-terminal bug site or something, since this triple-head box will be hex-head soon.
good idea
ah just for fun? nice
haha. blatently, yes :P
some kids spend $1000 on a graphics card. I see no point in that, ergonomics, features, accessories are my thing :)
identified and worked around the bug.
